column4: Any advice with regards to lack of sound when watching flash videos?
Are you using the Adobe flash plugin or something else?
I'm pretty sure its the official Adobe flash plugin. about:plugins reports it as libflashplayer.so & npwrapper.libflashplayer.so
should I be concerned that I seem to have both Flah 9.0 r48 & Flash 9.0 r31 installed at the same time under about:plugins
Seems like that could be an issue! :) You only need one.
ok, I'll see what happens if I remove one.
BTW, my version is "9.0 r124" and I believe I got it through the repositories--you may want to upgrade yours.
I'm thinking the best way to do that would be to sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree right? I don't currently have that package installed.
I originally installed it thru the repos--how did you install yours originally?
I think I went to a flash page, and I let firefox install the plugin.
ok, now I'm showing flash 9.0 r48, r 31, AND r124. I wonder how to get rid of r48 & r31
That's a really good question. I've never had to mess with uninstalling multiple plugins.
I'll go ask in the mozilla irc channel
Good idea. Stop by here again and let us know if you get it working. :)
Ok, problem fixed. I had 2 versions of Flash installed to my /home/.mozilla/plugins/ directory. After removing them, and installing the plugin from the repo I now have sound during Flash videos.
Great! So you just manually removed the files in the plugins directory? No special uninstallation necessary?

yeah, just a manual deleting was all that was necessary. I did have to go into about:config and change plugin.expose_full_path to true so that I knew where the 3 versions were. And I happen to be running firefox 2.0.0.14.
I'll have to remember that trick. I'm using FF2 also.
